intro: Eschscholzia physodes, commonly known as the Sierra foothill poppy, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Nevada. It is characterized by its striking, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually hairy as well. Eschscholzia physodes is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known poppy species.
